D E M 

D

decrypt(BigInteger) - Method in class MerkleHellmanKnapsack
Takes an encrypted message as a BigInteger value as input and decrypts it according to Merkle-Hellman Knapsack algoritm

Best Case: Big Theta (n^2)
Worst Case: Big Theta (n^2)
Pre-condition: The keys used for encryption must be used for decryption as well
Post-condition: The decrypted output bytes must be printable as readable characters and not a bit output stream

E

encrypt(byte[]) - Method in class MerkleHellmanKnapsack
Takes an array of bytes as input and encryptes it using Merkle-Hellman Knapsack algorithm

Best Case: Big Theta (n^2)
Worst Case: Big Theta (n^2)
Pre-condition: Input cannot be greater than 80 bytes
Post-condition: Final encrypted number must be a single BigInteger

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class MerkleHellmanKnapsack
Test driver for MerkleHellmanKnapsack.java
MerkleHellmanKnapsack - Class in <Unnamed>
Implementation of Merkle-Hellman Knaosack Encryption and Decryption algorithm using up to 80 bytes of data.
MerkleHellmanKnapsack() - Constructor for class MerkleHellmanKnapsack
constructor with no parameters initializes w and b
